title: Unauthorized / Fraudulent Charge Handling
description: Transactions reported as unauthorized must be investigated promptly, provisional credit offered when applicable, and card reissued if fraud is confirmed.
sample_violations: Agent failed to flag suspicious transactions
No provisional credit offered

title: Repeated Unresolved Complaints
description: Customers reporting the same issue multiple times (e.g., 2+ calls) indicate escalation and potential systemic failure.
sample_violations: Customer reported this is their 3rd call for same issue

title: Payment Processing Failures Affecting Deadlines
description: Payment system failures that prevent customers making on-time payments and expose them to late fees must be prioritized.
sample_violations: System outage prevented payment before due date

title: Data Privacy / PII Exposure
description: Any mention or evidence of personal information exposure (full PAN, SSN, PIN) must trigger privacy incident protocols and possible breach notification.
sample_violations: Agent read full PAN on an unsecured channel

title: Failure to Follow Dispute / Chargeback Procedures
description: Agents must follow documented dispute processes; failure can violate card network rules and consumer protection laws.
sample_violations: Dispute not submitted within required timeframe

title: Incorrect Fees or Misapplied Charges
description: Customers billed incorrectly (late fees, overlimit fees) must be corrected and credited when in error.
sample_violations: Late fee charged despite on-time payment

title: Failure to Provide Required Disclosures
description: Regulatory disclosures (rates, terms, fees) must be provided at required touchpoints; omissions are compliance issues.
sample_violations: Agent did not disclose APR change

title: Unapproved Account Changes / Upgrades
description: Changes to account settings, credit limits, or enrollment must have proper authorization and record of consent.
sample_violations: Limit increased without customer's explicit consent

title: TCPA / Call Consent Violations
description: Calling or messaging customers without consent or calling at prohibited times may violate TCPA and similar laws.
sample_violations: Contacted customer after DNC registration

title: Misrepresentation or Deceptive Practices (UDAAP)
description: Any misleading statements about products, fees, or remedies; deceptive promises are violations of UDAAP.
sample_violations: Agent promised expedited refund that was not allowed

title: Failure to Escalate High-Severity Cases
description: Cases meeting escalation criteria (fraud, severe financial harm, regulatory breach) must be promptly escalated.
sample_violations: Agent did not escalate when customer threatened legal action

title: Inadequate Recordkeeping / Missing Call Logs
description: Regulations require accurate records of communications and actions; missing logs hinder audits and investigations.
sample_violations: Call recording unavailable for disputed transaction

title: PCI-DSS Non-Compliance in Voice Channels
description: Sensitive cardholder data must not be stored or transmitted insecurely; PCI controls must be followed during calls.
sample_violations: Agent wrote down full card number in plain text

title: Inadequate KYC / Identity Verification
description: Failure to properly verify customer identity before revealing account details or performing sensitive actions.
sample_violations: Agent allowed account changes without proper verification

title: Improper Handling of Chargebacks vs Refunds
description: Misclassifying consumer complaints as refunds or vice versa can disrupt dispute tracking and violate rules.
sample_violations: Refund issued where dispute process required

title: Breach Notification Delays
description: Delayed notification to affected customers or regulators after a data breach can lead to regulatory penalties.
sample_violations: Customer informed weeks after confirmed breach

title: Discriminatory Treatment / Fair Lending Issues
description: Differential treatment or denial of services based on protected characteristics may violate fair lending and consumer protection laws.
sample_violations: Customer denied program due to location

title: Failure to Document Customer Consent for Recordings
description: Recording calls without required consent or failing to record consent is a compliance issue in many jurisdictions.
sample_violations: No consent recorded before recording call

title: Unauthorized Disclosure of Account Information
description: Discussing account details with unauthorized third parties or in public channels is prohibited.
sample_violations: Agent disclosed account balance to caller without authorization

title: Improper Refund Timing or Communication
description: Customers must be clearly advised about timelines for provisional credits and final resolution; false timelines are problematic.
sample_violations: Agent promised immediate full refund but process takes longer

title: FCRA - Incorrect Credit Reporting
description: Failure to correct or investigate inaccurate information reported to credit bureaus in a timely manner may violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA).
sample_violations: Customer disputed an item and reporting not updated

title: FDCPA - Harassment by Debt Collectors
description: Communications that are abusive, misleading, or harassing when collecting debt can violate the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA).
sample_violations: Collector threatened legal action improperly

title: ECOA - Discriminatory Credit Decision
description: Denying credit or treating applicants differently based on protected characteristics violates the Equal Credit Opportunity Act (ECOA).
sample_violations: Applicant was denied credit for improper discriminatory reasons

title: TILA - Failure to Provide Truth-in-Lending Disclosures
description: Failing to disclose APR, finance charges, or other material loan terms violates the Truth in Lending Act (TILA).
sample_violations: Agent did not provide required APR disclosure

title: GLBA - Improper Handling of Consumer Financial Data
description: Failure to protect or properly share consumer financial information can violate the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLBA) and internal privacy policies.
sample_violations: Customer data shared without proper disclosure or consent

title: CARD Act - Inadequate Notice for Rate/Fee Changes
description: Credit card customers must receive advance notice for significant rate or fee increases as required by the Credit CARD Act.
sample_violations: Customer was charged increased fees without advance notice

title: CFPB - Unfair or Deceptive Acts (UDAAP) Enforcement
description: Practices that are abusive, unfair, or deceptive may trigger CFPB enforcement under UDAAP guidelines.
sample_violations: Promotional language misrepresented actual terms

title: Credit Reporting - Failure to Provide Adverse Action Notice
description: Lenders must provide an adverse action notice when denying credit or taking other adverse actions based on information from credit reports.
sample_violations: Customer denied credit but not provided adverse action notice

title: Payment Protection - Failure to Honor Promised Provisional Credits
description: When provisional credits are promised pending investigation (e.g., for unauthorized transactions), they must be applied per regulation and internal SLA.
sample_violations: Provisional credit promised but not applied

title: FCRA - Furnisher Duty to Investigate
description: Entities that furnish information to credit reporting agencies must investigate consumer disputes, correct inaccurate data, and communicate results as required under the FCRA.
sample_violations: Furnisher failed to investigate consumer dispute within statutory timeframe

title: FCRA - Failure to Provide Adverse Action Based on Credit Report
description: When adverse actions (denial, increased rate) are taken based on credit report information, consumers must receive a compliant adverse action notice explaining the decision and source of information.
sample_violations: Customer denied credit without receiving adverse action notice

title: FCRA - Failure to Block or Correct Identity Theft Records
description: When a consumer reports identity theft, furnishers and CRAs must block or correct fraudulent information once validated under FCRA procedures.
sample_violations: Fraudulent account not blocked after identity theft report

title: CFPB - Failure to Properly Handle Consumer Complaints
description: Under CFPB guidance, covered firms must maintain effective complaint-handling processes and timely responses to consumer complaints; failures can lead to supervisory action.
sample_violations: Multiple complaints left unaddressed, consumer filed CFPB complaint

title: CFPB - Unfair or Deceptive Practices (UDAAP) in Marketing/Disclosure
description: Marketing or disclosure practices that mislead consumers about terms, fees, or remedies may constitute unfair or deceptive acts under CFPB enforcement priorities.
sample_violations: Promotional claims omitted material fees

title: CFPB - Failure to Maintain Compliance Program / Controls
description: Lack of adequate training, monitoring, or internal controls for consumer-facing operations can lead to systemic violations and CFPB supervisory actions.
sample_violations: Agent repeatedly violated call scripts; training records missing
